citations.title: Clinical Pharmacogenetics Implementation Consortium (CPIC) Guidelines for Codeine Therapy in the Context of Cytochrome P450 2D6 (CYP2D6) Genotype
Clinical Pharmacogenetics Implementation Consortium (CPIC) guidelines for cytochrome P450 2D6 (CYP2D6) genotype and codeine therapy: 2014 Update
Clinical Pharmacogenetics Implementation Consortium (CPIC) guideline for CYP2D6, OPRM1, and COMT genotype and select opioid therapy.

implications.CYP2D6: n/a

recommendations.drugrecommendation: No recommendation

implications.CYP2D6: Reduced O-desmethyltramadol (active metabolite) formation

recommendations.drugrecommendation: Use tramadol label recommended age- or weight-specific dosing. If no response and opioid use is warranted, consider non-codeine opioid.

implications.CYP2D6: Reduced O-desmethyltramadol (active metabolite) formation

recommendations.drugrecommendation: Use tramadol label recommended age- or weight-specific dosing. If no response and opioid use is warranted, consider non-codeine opioid.

implications.CYP2D6: Reduced O-desmethyltramadol (active metabolite) formation

recommendations.drugrecommendation: Use tramadol label recommended age- or weight-specific dosing. If no response and opioid use is warranted, consider non-codeine opioid.

implications.CYP2D6: Greatly reduced O-desmethyltramadol (active metabolite) formation leading to diminished analgesia.

recommendations.drugrecommendation: Avoid tramadol use because of possibility of diminished analgesia. If opioid use is warranted, consider a non-codeine opioid.

implications.CYP2D6: Increased formation of O-desmethyltramadol (active metabolite) leading to higher risk of toxicity

recommendations.drugrecommendation: Avoid tramadol use because of potential for toxicity. If opioid use is warranted, consider a non-codeine opioid.
